title: Texas News Minute
text:
KLTV Closed Captioning Texas News Minute 
DALLAS (AP) - Ahmed Mohamed's family has accepted a foundation's offer to pay for his high school and college in the Middle East. The 14-year-old Muslim boy arrested after a homemade clock he brought to his Dallas-area school was mistaken for a bomb recently visited Qatar (GUH'-tur) as part of a whirlwind month that included a visit to the White House on Monday. 
SAN ANTONIO (AP) - A jury in Bexar (bayr) County has sentenced a man to death for the ambush killing of a county sheriff's deputy. Investigators say Mark Gonzalez was drunk and on anti-depressants when he shot Kenneth Vann nearly 50 times in 2011. Gonzalez is the third Texan to receive the death penalty this year. 
FORT WORTH, Texas (AP) - Energy Future Holdings is suing to force a minority shareholder to go along with the sale of Oncor to Hunt Consolidated. Texas Transmission Investment LLC has balked at the proposed sale. But Energy Future says in a lawsuit filed in bankruptcy court that it has an agreement with the shareholder that would force it to sell its nearly 20 percent stake if Oncor is unloaded. 
NEW BRAUNFELS, Texas (AP) - Right place. Right time. Austin-Travis County emergency responders practicing swift water rescues in the Comal (KOH'-mal) River made a real-life save two weeks ago in New Braunfels. They pulled a boy from the water after he slipped off an inner tube. One of the responders was wearing a camera and it was all caught on video. Copyright 2015 The Associated Press. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten or redistributed. Can't Find Something?
